Dialogues.content: <Seems forever since I was home.>
<Looks like dinner is getting ready.>
Oh you're finally here, can we eat now?

It's always great to see my little sister! <She seems chipper today.> <I should click and drag in that indifferent tone onto the gray dialogue before the time runs out and see what happens. If I'm done before that, I can press SPACEBAR to speak.>
How is the family treating you?
Everyone's good right? But you know, whatever.
Whatever?! Jeez. Could you show you care, even just for a little bit! You can't just say everyone's good, when you don't even know what's going on.
I'm sorry.
S-sorry. I guess I'm just tired?
Now you just sound like you don’t know what to say..
<Here comes Dad from the living room.>
Hey, kiddo! Good to see you!
<Dad has a mustache now?>
Hi Dad. How are you and mom doing?
Hey Dad, I hope you and mom have been doing really well!
Oh, how nice of you to be concerned. I know I'm doing fine, but I can't speak for your mom.
<He doesn't know about Mom? Well, then...>
<And now Mom with the food.>
Hm...
<I wonder why Mom is so quiet.>
So, Mom, how are you?
Hey Mom. What's up with you, huh?
Oh? Sorry... you surprised me a bit. Nothing new.
You have a different hairstyle. That's new.
Anyone can see you have a new haircut, Mom.
So, your hair's different now?
Ohhh. You changed your hair up too?
I guess...your hair looks new...
I've had it for some time now. Thought a change would be nice.
It's been different for quite a bit, actually.
I did, a while back.
It does? Oh, you're referring to this old cut.
<I haven't come home in a long time, it seems.>
